Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees had a rough series versus the Washington Nationals, falling Tuesday and Wednesday.
The Yankees were out-hit 10-6 in their victory against the Cardinals.
Marcus Stroman lasted 7.0 innings with two earned runs in his start.
Will Warren (0-2, 9.68 ERA) will start for the Yankees.
The Cardinals had a 2-2 split in their series against the San Diego Padres.
The Cardinals blew a slim lead early in a 6-3 defeat to the Yankees on Friday.
Kyle Gibson (7-6, 4.54 ERA) will start for the Cardinals.
Gleyber Torres has recorded at least one hit in each of his last 12 appearances at Yankee Stadium against opponents with a losing record.
Juan Soto has recorded at least one single in three of his last four appearances with his team as a home favorite against the Cardinals.
Giancarlo Stanton has hit a home run in each of his last four appearances at Yankee Stadium against opponents with a losing record.
DJ LeMahieu has scored at least one run in each of his six previous appearances with his team as a favorite against the Cardinals.
Nolan Arenado has hit a home run in three of his last five appearances with his team as an underdog against the Yankees.
Masyn Winn has recorded a double in six of the Cardinals' last seven games against AL East opponents.
Paul Goldschmidt has recorded at least one RBI in each of the Cardinals' last five games.
Willson Contreras has recorded at least one hit in each of his last 11 appearances with his team as an underdog against AL East opponents.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is available to watch on BALLY and YES.
This is the second game in a three-game series between the Cardinals and Yankees.
